website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a garden fertilizer that is safe and works, you won't find a better deal – it's a modern, concentrated formula of time-tested ingredients known to produce results.
pros: A popular, multi-purpose fertilizer that won't burn when directions are followed
Improvements in plants are noticeable with recommended use – every 1 to 2 weeks
cons: Some owners report damage to small, delicate plants such as herbs and seedlings, but harm can be avoided in most cases by closely following recommended guidelines

customer_reviews.title: PASS!!! DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! If you do, you will get hoodwinked like the rest of us!! This is a pocket size mini box of miracle grow that would probably dispense from a gumball machine! In not even kidding. Completely misleading. Seller says the box dimensions are way bigger....NOT!! Originally sells for $10.99..???..LOL!!
customer_reviews.author: Ruthann Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is excellent, but don't be fooled by the deception
customer_reviews.text: This was a big rip-off! Don't let the picture fool you. It's half the size of what my wife gets at Walmart, but for twice as much money. The product itself is excellent, but don't be fooled by the deception.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Just received this product and extremely disappointed in the size and price
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product and extremely disappointed in the size and price. I expected to get a larger portion due to the product picture and the products Technical Details indicating Item Dimensions as 4.75 x 10.75 x 15.75 inches. Actual product sold dimensions is 2.5 x 2.5 x 4.0 inches. This is only 8 oz. for over $6 ($.75/oz). The exact same name product sells at $9 for 80 ozs. ($.1125/oz) at most home improvement stores. In both cases, size and price, a complete scam and Amazon should take action against matters like this. As one other comment stated, lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stricklin

customer_reviews.title: Pathetically Small
customer_reviews.text: Each of these boxes is 8 ounces. To put that in perspective, if you've ever bought the large plastic canister or box that has four packets for a Miracle Grow or similar feeder, the entire contents of this box is half the size of one packet that you get in the canister.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you read the label
customer_reviews.text: I know that I should read the text more carefully, but this is a tiny box of fertilizer. Lowes sell a 5lb pound box for $9.50. the picture makes it look much larger than it is.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product!  I have proof!
customer_reviews.text: I chair our town Flower Project which includes 40 barrels and 7 large planters. I have my volunteers apply Bloom Booster half strength very week from June through August. All I can say is that it does an incredible job of promoting blooming all summer long. Just look at the picture!
customer_reviews.author: Gary & Michelle Kemp

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR BAMBOO
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was messed up when it arrived but the contents were fine so I didn't worry too much about it. The description says this is safe for all household plants and such. I mixed the exact proportions in the instructions and used it for my potato plant and bamboo plant. My brother also used it for his bamboo plant. It literally killed my plant overnight and the leaves on his died. My potato is fine right now, so just... Don't use this on bamboo, I guess. It's not safe for all plants, after all. I'll update this if something changes with my potato.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Product not the size stated in the description. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: In the description of this product, it states that the dimensions of this product are 4.75 x 10.75 x 15.75 inches. I was expecting a large container. Instead i got a tiny box that is 2 1/2" X 2 1/2" X 4". I am returning this for a refund. I use Miracle Grow all the time but this purchase was a total rip off. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Flower Fertilizer
customer_reviews.text: I just recently learned that too much nitrogen makes your plant green and healthy but you won't get any flowers. The first number describing the fertilizer must be lower than the two other two ie: 10-52-10 or 7-32-12, not 10-10-10 or 24-8-16
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Penny

customer_reviews.title: Amazing flowering!
customer_reviews.text: I have not seen this many flowers on my hibiscus since using this. I had forgotten what color the blooms were. Three weeks later I saw red flowers everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Blanche

customer_reviews.title: OMG I LOVE THIS! I bought rose roots from Home Depot
customer_reviews.text: OMG I LOVE THIS! I bought rose roots from Home Depot, planted them and watered them daily and waited for them to catch and spring. Nothing grew for two months!! So I thought let me try this miracle grow as a last resort. Once I added this within days they startrd to bloom. They caught!! Now I give them this food every two weeks and now my rose bushes grew and grew and even started to flower. after only a month I have beautiful little rose bushes growing.
customer_reviews.author: Ileana Banisor

customer_reviews.title: The plant Food good enough
customer_reviews.text: This year I use the product for my flowers and vegetables, that is very good. Thx!
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaYiu

customer_reviews.title: This is an incredibly small package.
customer_reviews.text: I've never seen this small package for sale anywhere. It looks like a free sample package that the manufacturer would give to a nursery. You can get a much much better per ounce price on larger packages.
customer_reviews.author: MacTownFun

customer_reviews.title: All purpose fertilizer!
customer_reviews.text: 15-30-15 very good water soluble fertilizer. In the past it was called " All Purpose Plant Food" and the REAL Bloom Buster was 15-52-10 see photo, unfortunately you cannot find it anymore :-(
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: A good blend for containers or older garden beds, but not good for vegetables in nitrogen-rich soil
customer_reviews.text: This water soluble fertilizer blend is awesome in garden beds that are well-established and only amended with organic products or compost occasionally through the growing season. Don't follow the instructions, use 1 Tbsp for every 1 Gallon Watering Can and follow a schedule of roughly ~10-12 days for garden beds. For stuff like peppers and tomatoes, give the leaves a bit of the fertilizer water (foliar feeding), and then a few seconds near the base of the plant.
customer_reviews.author: BestReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. I have been using this product for years ...
customer_reviews.text: Truely a Miricle. Highly recommend. I have been using this product for years and everyone says I have an amazing green thumb. This won't burn your plants and they grow like magic. Just a note: I have heard that weed killer works by causing the weed to grow itself to death. Too much fertilizer is not better. But you also need to know when a plant has a lot of flower production it needs to be fed every day, especially if it's a full sun plant like petunias.
customer_reviews.author: Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Small box, but great product.
customer_reviews.text: Of course this works well. Everyone knows that. Pay attention to the size/amount. It was a smaller box than what I expected. It’s a little bag inside of the box. I’ll just buy it in the store next time so I can see what I’m getting. I gave it a five because the actual product is good. I could have figured out the amount if I’d taken the time to research it. So, it’s not their fault. Don’t make the same mistake I did. You’ve been warned!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Gro 10-52-10
customer_reviews.text: Happy to find this version of Miracle Gro with the P value at least double the N and K, as in N-P-K, (nitrogen-phosphorus-potassium), I was taught that flowering plants like high phosphorus, and that N contributes to greenery growth, and K (potassium) helps stalk strength and sweetness. This was the best buy. Happy to get it so quickly. Since the P number is so high, I was delighted to mix my previous purchases of Miracle Gro soluble fertilizers with a lower P value with it to bring up their nourishing value to my plants. So easy to feed with every watering - 2 tsp per gallon of water.
customer_reviews.author: TX_Betty_in_NH

customer_reviews.title: Great for tomatoe& Pepper seedlings
customer_reviews.text: I've started using this fertilizer on my tomato & pepper seedlings that I started inside at the end of March. It has definitely made a difference in their growth rate. I could notice a difference about a week after the very first application. Happy I gave this product a try.
customer_reviews.author: yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Loss of Plant Food
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this product for years and it works great! However, in this most recent purchase, the larger bag was open and 2 of the 4 bags inside with the plant food were open, which spilled the plant food out into the larger bag. This wouldn’t have been a big deal except for the fact the large bag had a hole in the bottom, so all the spilled plant food ended up in the bottom of the box and then leaked out through the bottom of the box. Plus, there was no scoop inside. The box wasn’t damaged at all, so the issue must have occurred at the manufacturing level.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for my container gardening. Once a month I use the measuring spoon included to sprinkle a little of the 'sand' on top of the soil around the plant base in each container. The daily watering or rain feeds it slowly to the roots and I get a HUGE crop every year.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Midnight

customer_reviews.title: They seem to love it. I have a ton of bushes and ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have my gardenias write the review. They seem to love it. I have a ton of bushes and they all get it several times during the growing season, as do the azaleas, fuchias, and others. Grow like weeds on this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: NMB

customer_reviews.title: Rejuvenated my sad house plants!
customer_reviews.text: I have two indoor pothos plants (Charlotte and Rapunzel) that have been stalled in growth for the last year or so, despite plenty of sun and a regular watering schedule. I've tried the plant food sticks, and they seemed to help just a little bit, but didn't make any dramatic different in growth. Buying this powdered plant food was a game-changer, though; I add a teeny-tiny scoop to their water pail once every week or two, and just a few hours after a watering there is a visible difference in how springy and alive they look! This stuff has been a total blessing for me, since I typically have whatever the opposite of a green thumb is. Treat yo plants!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Well the stores in the area did not have this stocked and my tomatoes are still growing.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for tomato plants every time I have grown them from a full fledged garden to tomato plants in large pots. My tomato plants are still growing and producing since I could move them inside for the few freezing days we have had, but I ran out of plant food and the local stores were not expecting to restock for 4 to 6 weeks. The price is comparable though I don't have to pay for shipping when I purchase locally. Pic is a Celebrity tomato grown on 01-26-2019
customer_reviews.author: Leia Sulee

customer_reviews.title: I use this once a week on my plants and cannot say enough good about the product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for several years now and cannot get over how much bigger my tomato plants are and how many more tomatoes they have on them each year. I use this once a week on my plants and cannot say enough good about the product
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nesbit

customer_reviews.title: Love this all purpose fertilizer.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this fertilizer came in 3 separate packs inside one box. I can easily store one smaller pack outside in my watering can with measuring spoon included for a quick mix of solution. I actually just close top of package with clothespin. When finished watering just slide back in watering can. No need to worry with one large bulky bag.
customer_reviews.author: AKLC18

customer_reviews.title: Happy sobriety plant!!
customer_reviews.text: Who knew?? Plant food makes your plants grow! Lol! My "sobriety" plant was slowly dying. I got this plant when I graduated from my intensive outpatient program 3 years ago. So I bought this plant food and the damn thing has tripled in size. Hahaaa!! I use a tiny amount about once every two weeks. So happy!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Works, but them chemicals tho!
customer_reviews.text: Okay so if you’re looking for your plants to grow like CRAZY then this is the product for you so I must give it 5 stars. But... I didn’t realize this was a Monsanto product and I guess didn’t really didn’t know what plant food was and bought it from a friend’s recommendation. Literally little baby leaves starting sprouting all over my Pothos plant like 3 days after giving it the miracle grow which, is far from natural, it actually scared me lmao. I will be exploring more natural and organic options from now on but if you don’t care then this product will definitely make your plant grow lightening fast!
customer_reviews.author: Estella

customer_reviews.title: This is what really brings may flowers
customer_reviews.text: Hi folks. This is Flower Bob. This is what you need to for great and plentiful blooms. We did a test of this vs, regular miracle grow, and this really does make more blooms. Because we use this outdoors mostly, we put half of the little scoop on the soil before we wate or expect there will be rain. Note: we do not put it close to the plant.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Great for your acid lovers!
customer_reviews.text: My blueberries really love this stuff and they do well when I use it on them. I notice a big difference and my plants tell me when they need more by the looks of them. This will really make your evergreens a lush dark green too. It has a way of making everything bloom with a nice pop.
customer_reviews.author: Amulek

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Fertilizer - Excellent Convenience - Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfectly balanced fertilizer for feeding many types of plants throughout the year, but we especially like it for giving the spring seedlings of flowers and herbs a great start. The box is sized well for feeding several (15+) small to medium plots and pots for the growing season. The price was the same as home stores (delivered with Prime) and we did not have to make a trip.
customer_reviews.author: SeekingExcellence

customer_reviews.title: Bargain despite the size
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I'd imagined. I thought it was the square box one sees in the gardening section of stores. It's much smaller. Howeve, as I only have a few potted plants it will last long enough. Here in Florida the humidity is so high, I rarely got through an entire box before it was in melted clumps, so this will be a better value for me. Besides free delivery to my door and not having to deal with a big box store and their parking lot makes this a real bargain. I'll purchase again
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Jent

customer_reviews.title: Plants are happily growing now (no green thumb)!
customer_reviews.text: My plants are growing much better than they were when only using plain water vs adding this plant food to the plain water. So same amount of watering the plants, the only difference in care is adding the plant food. According to my pictures, I had the product in my hand as of 7/27/2019. I have been using it pretty consistent since then. I don't have many pictures, but I have a set from 3/2018 (over a year before purchasing the product) with a moderate/scarce amount of leaves, then 9/2019 (1 month after using the product), which shows new leaf growth sprouting in areas it never sprouted before, then 2/2020 with many new leaves every where.
customer_reviews.author: M S.

customer_reviews.title: Salvaged Our Gardenia!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how regular feeding this the proper plant food can salvage a gardenia with too many yellow leaves for comfort. On an every two week feeding schedule with this plant food, the leaves are once again all green and the plant is flowering. Truly a miracle!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: working well on my tomatoes
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, it's hard to tell the impact it's having on the plants. But one of my plants didn't have any tomatoes even though the rest did. After starting this fertilizer, there were a couple starting to grow in about 4 days. The other plants seem to be doing better too. I can't say for sure how good the fertilizer is, but my plants are doing very well and I've been using it weekly.
customer_reviews.author: basketballnan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect food for transplanting seedlings from an aerogarden
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I've been starting my plants in my aerogarden, and transplanting them onto Coco coir. So they need to have nutrients added. So far, they've been doing great. I did have trouble understanding and deciding which miracle grow product to use, but this seemed to be the best choice. A large amount had spilled out of the ripped bag, but I'll manage with what is left for now. Overall, it's a great product
customer_reviews.author: Kareem and Samantha Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly, it works!
customer_reviews.text: Works, surprisingly. We planted a bunch of 8’ trees along the south edge of our property about 6 years back. They grew marginally (15-20% maybe) until we started using this product 3 years ago. Since they have nearly doubled in size, and several trees that were severely windburned have filled in almost completely. I attribute the change to this product because nothing else changed significantly in that period.
customer_reviews.author: William Goodnow

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is excellent for Camelias. It saved our Camelias.
customer_reviews.text: I simply toss this material down at the base of a camelia then spray water so it dissolves and sinks in. The sprinklers then over time work it down further. Within days, at most a week, there is fresh growth, fresh light, bright green leaves. It is obviously attributable to the product. One puts it down after the flowering of the winter. We had renovations and the sprinkler system was hit and miss as electricity was cut on and off. The camelias suffered. But this stuff has brought them back. A couple of bushes will need to have branches cut off, but I am happy to see the very old and healthy bushes coming back to life.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Flood

customer_reviews.title: Best food for my roses.
customer_reviews.text: This is such an inexpensive way to make my roses look their best. Some of my roses have been finicky and straight up refused to bloom. Minimal foliage geothermal and overall just not much going on with them for almost a year. So I thought I’d give this a try. And I am SO happy I did. Within a week I saw new leaves and within a month a had buds all over the plants. Now is use a weak solution of this food weekly. My roses have never been happier.
customer_reviews.author: SurfsUp

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat this for sprinkling it on
customer_reviews.text: I'm back to this after years of trying other methods of fertilizing. Always Miracle Gro. And I do it my way, which is to wait for rain. I dump a package into an upcycled shaker canister (e.g. rabbit repellent granules), go out before or during rain, and sprinkle it on everything I want to fertilize. I'm sure the manufacturer would shudder at my method. But you know what? Everything grows.
customer_reviews.author: Ginjen

customer_reviews.title: It's a-LIVE! Yay!!!
customer_reviews.text: I replanted this plant into a larger pot and (after some research) determined it was in shock. Leaves turned yellow and broke off. I mixed a little of the MiracleGro in water, poured it in and crossed my fingers. Now MULTIPLE new leaves are coming in! The only thing that caused me a little grief was mixing it up in the right proportions. I didn't need a gallon of solution for one plant so I guessed at it and apparently guessed pretty well. I definitely don't have a green thumb and have killed many a plant in my day, so this is a must-have!
customer_reviews.author: wbrenda312

customer_reviews.title: Readily dissolvable, not for hydroponics use
customer_reviews.text: I have some earthboxex on my deck that I grow vegetables in. Although at the beginning of every season, I would replace the fertilizer strip within, I always worry that my plants are growing too fast that they would use up the nutrients before the end of the growing season. In some forum posts some gardeners said they occasionally, perhaps once every week to 2 weeks, they put some miracle-gro into their earthboxes to feed their plants as a "snack." I started doing it occasionally, and my plants seem to be pretty happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Bernard C

customer_reviews.title: Hard to dissolve
customer_reviews.text: The granules are very big and it takes time to dissolve in water. I have recently started gardening so I don’t have much experience but have used it multiple times on my indoor plants but there is no difference. Not sure if this is even working or not. I see that the product says it works magic but I am yet to see and experience that magic.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Mah

customer_reviews.title: The caviar of flower food
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products that everyone imitates but never duplicates. All I can say is, follow the directions exactly (you can't use too much of this stuff), water your flowers early in the morning (5AMish) and stand back. This will become part of your standard arsenal of fertilizers. Your neighbors will want to know what you are doing, but keep it to yourself. Works well on every flowering plant I have. It will also make Plumeria Trees bloom like crazy!!!
customer_reviews.author: crispinmilk

customer_reviews.title: Miracle!
customer_reviews.text: This is really a miracle! Leaves on my plant finally turned green! I have used other fertilizers. In particular the Miracle Grow Shake and Feed without any success. This one is different. The only fault is the packaging. It says "Easy open" ha... I pulled the sides apart with all my might but the package stayed sealed. The dosage is also not well thought off. It is hard to find a one and a half gallon container for me. One gallon would be better. Other than that there is no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Cotick Somick

customer_reviews.title: Tomatoes love it
customer_reviews.text: I try to be 100% organic, but Miracle Gro For Tomatoes (18-18-21 NPK) just works soooo well in getting the plants to flower and set fruit. I still feed organic fertilizer for slow release, but give my tomatoes, peppers, tomatillos, watermelons, etc... a big drink of Miracle Gro For Tomatoes every 14 days in between.
customer_reviews.author: ohYew812

customer_reviews.title: Truly like a miracle!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for years, and it has turned my thumbs green! I have a 2nd floor apartment, and neighbors walk by, pausing to admire my balcony plants. My daughter lives in Hawaii, and recently lamented that she cannot grow plants like I do in spite of her perfect climate (I live in Massachusetts), so I asked her if she feeds her plants. She said no, so I said "Miracle Gro, Amazon". She took the hint, and reports that her plants are now thriving too.
customer_reviews.author: Westport Reader

customer_reviews.title: Thanks AMAZON my house plants love miracle grow
customer_reviews.text: Thanks AMAZON my house plants love miracle grow. This plant feeding kit is the same great buy for feeding your plants, a little goes a long way. I appreciate the delivery and as a prime member loving 2 day delivery and all the other perks.
customer_reviews.author: Grace is Rewards 7-11

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this - I've been growing basil all summer indoors, but then the leaves started getting all yellow and gross. I don't know why it never occurred to me I should be using plant food!! I used it and immediately they sprung back to live and have been producing amazing basil! It is a small box but lasts a long time, and comes with a small measuring spoon to measure the appropriate amounts for I think a 1/2 gallon (the size of my watering can) and a larger size. Love this.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Kam

customer_reviews.title: Tomatoes everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I notice a big difference when I use this stuff and when I don't. When I use it, the tomatoes are so prolific! I grow cherry tomatoes and the yield is amazing! I use a self-watering system and add the plant food directly to the water. Other plant foods do not dissolve in water as easily (the kind where you sprinkle on top or hammer in as stakes into the ground). I like this because of the easy solubility in water. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: ER Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Great product for light-duty pruning
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended to me by a fellow gardener to me. As she has arthritis in her hands. it helps for her to have the option of holding a pruner so light to deadhead some flowers as opposed to holding a good quality pruner which tends to weights at least 2-3 lbs. I couldn't agree more with her in this regard. Besides, I also like the fact that I could open and close the pruner at will with one hand. Works for me alright. The only thing that is not so appealing. i.e., that this pruner looks a little cheap so it is made in cheap plastic. But so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: N Star

customer_reviews.title: Quality plant food
customer_reviews.text: We needed plant food for our first attempt at gardening in a new home. Knowing the quality of Miracle Grow from past larger gardens, we order this which can be used with the sprayer or mixed in a watering can for smaller gardens. Ours is smaller so we have used the measuring spoon and our watering can; it works well, our produce is big, and we knew we could count on Miracle Grow to give our plants a boost. This is a good buy and we will order again for our next garden.
customer_reviews.author: Gentleman Farmer

customer_reviews.title: This is a not a good deal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two boxes of this fertilizer not understanding the amount that is included in the box. The photos make it seem as this is the full size box (5 lbs). That 5 lbs box normally sells for about 10 dollars, so 2 dollars a pound. This box here is a micro-miniature box that is half a pound (8 oz). Do yourself a favor and get the normal size 5 lb box.
customer_reviews.author: silverboi

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know squat about plants. This is my 2nd time having a garden and I am learning as I go. This was recommended to me by a friend. I couldn’t believe how little was needed to go such a long way. It dissolved without any issues. My plants perked right up and we are getting a lot more vegetables - to the point I had to make sauces and dishes and put them in the freezer so they would not go to waste. I’m impressed and sold on future purchases
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Seeing beneficial effects but doesn't dissolve easily in my water
customer_reviews.text: The box is full of a bunch of individual plastic bag packets of the product. It's a bit messy trying to scoop out of them. It's probably my water quality but warm or cold, it doesn't dissolve well so if I put it in a watering can, the blue grit is always all stuck at the bottom and only comes out for the last pour. Has to be used frequently
customer_reviews.author: J. BushTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I don't feel this works as well as regular Miracle Grow
customer_reviews.text: As a long-time gardener and Miracle Grow and formerly known as Miracid (now the blue Miracle grow) user, I thought I would try this on my many blooming plants and flowers. When I use the blue Miracle Grow here in Florida, I notice a difference in days. As far as I can tell this product did absolutely nothing. I will continue to by the other two Miracle grow products, but will NEVER spend the money on this item again. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen F

customer_reviews.title: Saved my roses!
customer_reviews.text: My roses were doing quite well until they were attacked by aphids. I found a good organic spray to rid the roses of these little critters, but they did a lot of damage and the roses were pretty mottled and beat up. I've been using MiracleGro for my evergreens with great success so I figured the Rose food would help the roses through this stress. Within days, after 1 gallon water to 1 Tablespoon MiracleGro Rose Food each day x 3 days, the roses bounced back, with new shoots, new leaves and large, beautiful roses. Will definitely keep using.
customer_reviews.author: naekae

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the results
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically use artificial fertilizers. However my Pink lemonade blueberry plants were starving for iron. I did some research and found out that my plants could not take up iron from the soil if it was not acidic enough. I applied the 1st treatment and then waited 3 weeks Before applying and the 2nd treatment. I then waited more week before Applying an iron supplement to the soil. So far I'm pleased with the results that I'm seeing.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Wrisley

customer_reviews.title: Really works & produces great roses!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Miracle Grow for 25 years & have had excellent results with it. I have used the Rose Feed for the last three years on some roses that I thought were not going to survive. Not only have they survived but every bush has tripled in size & already has new buds. I won't use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: THUNDER DRAGON

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I have to write this review to combat the foolish people who say that they received a smaller than advertised product and gave this seller a 1 star. Please use common sense and read the description before making the purchase. I bought the largest option and it was cheaper than buying from places like Lowe's or Home Depot. The product works well and my garden is thriving. I would definitely buy from this seller again. I'm a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy N

customer_reviews.title: Great for hollies!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been growing several varieties of hollies around my property for years. I had a few that were stunted and more open than the others. I started watering them with Miracid a little over a month ago, once per week and the number of new buds and branches I have coming off the previously under performing shrubs is amazing. This product can really wake a shrub up and help fill it out. In July I will cut back to once every other week and stop in mid August so the new growth can harden in before winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a penny earned is a penny saved.
customer_reviews.text: this is dirt cheap.which is where it belongs. for which i apply to my garden with some frequency. last i looked my beanstalk was off in the clouds. i think now i may need a slight dose of pesticide. some bug named jack was on it.
customer_reviews.author: lionsroarcatsdonot

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I like this fertilizer. My azaleas are not blooming well for the past 5 years. I don't know what's the problem. I use the MG slow release rose in bloom fertilizer and epsom salt for the past years and not helping at all. I was planning to dispose and replace it with different plants. I decided to try this fertilizer. After 2 applications of this MG specific for azalea, my azaleas are blooming profusely and I am happy and satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: nel

customer_reviews.title: Has worked wonders for my front garden!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 rose bushes after winter that were planted a year ago as small starter bushes. I also had to replant a small bush of one that didn't survive winter. Thus food has worked SO WELL! Look at those beautiful flowers! My newest tiny rose bush has already had 2 blooms and lots of new growth. It is easy to use and you can use it on other house plants and outdoor plants. I give this to my garden all of which is newly planted except the 2 larger bushes. They have been really thriving! I do wish the food came in a resealable bag but that is my onlh complaint
customer_reviews.author: Kate B.

customer_reviews.title: Food for petunias
customer_reviews.text: I utilize this food for petunias and other flowering plants. Flowers last longer and the plant produces more of them than with other plant foods I have tried. This 4 pound box comes with 4 individual 1 pound packages. This box represents at least a 25 percent savings in cost per pound compared with the 1 pound boxes available at various outlets I have utilized in the past. No evidence of overfeeding when used as directed (with watering can - use only amount of liquid equivalent to normal watering) every 10 days; however, liquid can leave a white residue on leaves at point of contact when fed - especially on a very hot day.
customer_reviews.author: O. Workshops

customer_reviews.title: Great on Potted Herbs
customer_reviews.text: I mixed the Miracle-Gro water soluble granules for herbs with water, and watered my four basil & two rosemary plants, which are potted in clay planters, and placed on the window sill in my condo unit. The leaves seem larger every day. I've already snipped all of the plants that were fertilized for several dinners. Fresh basil.is great on salads & rosemary is best on meats & poultry in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: WJL

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT - GREAT RESULTS  !
customer_reviews.text: We use Miracle Grow Plant Food every month for our house plants, and for our outdoor gardens. A friend of mine recommended this product, and based on her extraordinary success with using Miracle Grow to 'feed' her outstandingly gorgeous collection of Christmas Cactus and other Succulents, I started following her Miracle Grow recommendations. Its working perfectly on our indoor plants, and in our Greenhouse :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kathryne H.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Packaging
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent and it serves the purpose. The way it arrived at my place did not make me happy at all. As I was opening the outer brown box, the product had spilled inside already and went all over my living room carpet and kitchen floor. The outside box had gaps in the corners and the plant food crystals spilled everywhere. I will surely not order this product from the same vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Roses - Happy Gardener!
customer_reviews.text: Great for newly planted roses - one bare root had no leaves. Established roses are very, very happy. Easy to use, neighbor from across the street commented on my roses, so I happily gave her some for hers. Miracle-Geo Products are let in my shed because of the results!
customer_reviews.author: Kat C.

customer_reviews.title: Makes your roses bloom!
customer_reviews.text: This worked its magic and made my pitiful outdoor pots of white roses grow! In the matter of a few days after first using, new buds were sprouting. Now, almost a little over 1 month later, my pots are filled with luscious leaves and blooming roses! I make it a point to feed them about once every 1-1.5 weeks. My roses are thriving!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Basic, go to all around fertilizer for new plant parents.
customer_reviews.text: As someone that grew up in a family of triple threat plant nerds ( dad and 5 generations back. All at least had Masters or better PhD in Botany, Horticulture & agriculture. Yep! All 3) this is the one & done universal fertilizer for most every basic need. More experienced plant/garden folks can customize their fertilizer. But if you are new to plant parenting this is your go to.
customer_reviews.author: K. Saiz

customer_reviews.title: A must if you're growing tomatoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my third year growing tomatoes in my backyard garden. Two years ago I grew without miracle-Gro and last year I fed them the tomato plant food on a weekly schedule. I saw a massive difference in the size and yield, and the tomatoes were juicier and firmer. I'm using this from now on.
customer_reviews.author: erik b. prestbury

customer_reviews.title: Useful, especially if you don't necessarily follow directions
customer_reviews.text: I've had the best results with the Miracle Gro line of products when not applying the full recommended amount - instead fertilizing with smaller amounts on a more frequent basis. Not a substitute for unsatisfactory soil.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo St. DuBois

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works!
customer_reviews.text: Love be this stuff. Makes my plants grow like crazy when I use it regularly. Especially my outdoor annuals. Our growing season is so short in Wyoming so you need to give plants all the help they can get. I didn’t use last summer and nothing blumed or grow much. My Day Lillies are really taking off this year even though our warm weather was slow coming. And my inside plants do great with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: WyogalTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Good soluble fertilizer for tomatoes and flowering plants
customer_reviews.text: Immediately saw benefit of the Miracle-gro tomato water soluble plant food on tomatoes and other plants. Pleased that product dissolved completely in watering can, assuring me of equal distribution. 0ne pound doesn’t go far with the number of container plants I have. But my experience with the product gives me the confidence to buy larger, more cost-effective size.
customer_reviews.author: GardenGoddess

customer_reviews.title: Works for Arabian jasmine
customer_reviews.text: We used it for Arabian jasmine. Our plant’s leaves we’re getting yellow and didn’t know what to do. A friend suggested using acidic fertilizer and it helped a lot. We have used two so far, and the leaves are already getting greener.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was really disapointed about this . for some reason I ordered it for the second time thinking it was a larger portion. Its not a valie for your money . It's slouch a small box. The smallest one I have ever seen really. The bigger box sells for roughly 5 bucks. In wich is about 3 times more.. So No I am not satisfied and feel it is a watse of money. I feel dooped
customer_reviews.author: Nelly

customer_reviews.title: The SIZE Though......
customer_reviews.text: I really thought you all were being dramatic about the size of this product, my apologies. Yes, it is very little lol. It looks bigger in the professional product pictures, but in reality, it is quite small. I let it slide because I didn't have to pay for it, I used a gift card. Still, I was pressed when I went to Walmart and discovered that you can get almost three times the amount (certainly a bigger box) AT THE SAME PRICE!!! If you can, just go to Walmart to get the same product, or if you have a gift card and Amazon Prime, get it here, I guess lol.
customer_reviews.author: Proverbs_Sef

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Acidic Fertilizer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on recommendation from Costa Farms a major Florida wholesale nursery specifically to encourage Ixora blooming. After a few applications I am starting to see results. Advise you buy a PH meter which are low cost on Amazon to monitor soil conditions. Also avoid getting on concrete and flood any adjacent concrete with water. Iron in product will leave yellow stains.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Turned My Thumb Green
customer_reviews.text: I kill everything. But as long as I use MiracleGro I know it's going to thrive. Amazing stuff. Bought this box specifically for a gardenia plant I'm NOT going to kill this time. I live in TN but I'm from NC and in NC we had gardenias that bloomed twice a year. I miss that so much but I think MiracleGro is finally going to keep this gardenia not only alive, but thriving. It looks fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Hamilton Overcast

customer_reviews.title: Citrus. Gardenias, Toubochina (princess flower) Hydrangeas need this
customer_reviews.text: I have used Miracle Grow for at least 25 years and have been expanding my knowledge about which plants need acidic soil.FYI, when plants yellow from the tips on down it is an iron deficiency, from the bottom up its a nitrogen deficiency and liquid fertilizer cures it the fastest. I can usually see some effect from Miracle Grow/ Miracid within a week after using. I use both throughout the spring and summer and my garden is always awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Bumblebee

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly as described. exactly. the pencil next to the box of plat food will tell you a lot. The dimensions are 4.25” x 2.5”. Very small. very small nothing like i expected to water all of my flower and vegetable garden. The picture makes it look like a normal 8lb box. next time i'll look more closely at the size of the package. Not recommended for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gordo

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for the size. You can buy it anywhere ...
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced for the size. You can buy it anywhere else online and get twice the size for less money. RIPOFF
customer_reviews.author: steve drago

customer_reviews.title: Made a HUGE difference.
customer_reviews.text: My petunias, million bells, black elephant ears, and Lorapetalums love this stuff. I wish it was a little more economical since I blow through it pretty quickly with weekly feedings. 4 individual bags measured out to fit a Miracle Grow hose end feeder. It takes me 2 bags to do my plants and flowers so this box only lasts 2 weeks based on a weekly feeding. The results are fantastic though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Missing important pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I like using Miracle Grow products because they are usually worth the extra money. This shipped quickly, was packaged nicely. But, it was missing the dual measuring scoop. Which was a disappointment. I do not want to use my measuring scoops for baking in fertilizer. Definitely not easy to use when you cannot get an accurate measurement and the bag is not built for easy pouring (it would be perfect for scooping.. if you had the scooper!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping that this would work...
customer_reviews.text: ...and it DID. I finally found something that makes my gardenias bloom, even in AZ!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Yay!  Found it!
customer_reviews.text: The 4 lb bloom booster is the hard to find 10-52-10 NPK. It’s the high phosphorus that supports bloom growth.
customer_reviews.author: 123kate

customer_reviews.title: Everything is better with this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used it in some kind of cacti in my bedroom window...some flower thing has grown 4 feet + in a week from it! It’s incredible! Put some in a celery root to see if it would grow...yup, leaves sprouting right up. Put some in water with a piece of turmeric sprouting roots. A BiG leaf about 10” grew! High recommendation, have no idea why or how it works. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy3339

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Light works well. I had trouble with a timer in that the light was not turning on, wrote seller and they responded very quickly with an opportunity to trade out the light. I realized the timer was at fault not the light but appreciated the customer service they exhibited. I use for vegetable starts and the plants did not get leggy.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Thomas Jr

customer_reviews.title: Seems to do the job
customer_reviews.text: Growing a mint patch, have already cut a huge portion before last pic so it seems to be having an effect.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: My plants are happy and well fed.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Miracle Gro for years. My plants seem to thrive when I use it in addition to maintaining the right conditions for each plant. If you have been using Miracle Gro potting soil for more than 30 days, the soil can become depleted of nutrients. So after 30 days it's a good idea to start feeding. This size is a good value for a very concentrated product that can make gallons of liquid fertilizer. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BRIDEOFHYDE

customer_reviews.title: Best Tomato plant food on this planet.
customer_reviews.text: We had to look high and low for this product. I am not sure why it is not carried in stores. They say that they have it but they do not in fact carry this one. Please read the label carefully to make sure to are buying the right product. It comes in 3 separate 1lb bags for easy storage. Only use what you need. Your tomatoes will love it.
customer_reviews.author: jfisher

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a loooonnng way
customer_reviews.text: This is an effective and easy to use plant fertilizer. I've seen some reviews complaining about the size of the package. This is relatively concentrated, & a little goes a long way. If this was for lawn use, it may be effectively used with appropriate dilution in a lawn sprayer. But that is not what it was designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Brer Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Tried-and-True boost for plants
customer_reviews.text: This is a nearly fool-proof way to feed your plants; flower or vegetable, inside and outside plants, It is a staple in our otherwise completely organic vegetable garden. Plants grow big & strong, You just need to get the powder to water ratio right, which is easy if you read the directions and use the provided measuring scoop.
customer_reviews.author: W. W.

customer_reviews.title: Hibiscus plants looking great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to fertilize some hibiscus plants that had yellow leaves and after a couple applications of Miracle Grow acidic fertilizer, plants are looking great and producing lots of flowers. Have also been using on citrus trees with great results.
customer_reviews.author: RicksV

customer_reviews.title: No better than reg Miracle-Gro for me
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I cannot see any difference in my petunias, vinca, inpatients, marigolds, dipladenias or knockout roses. I live in super hot and humid zone 8A with little summer rain so everything is watered by hand. Maybe you will have better resultsin another zone. For me, too little for too much.
customer_reviews.author: Nonamemarine

customer_reviews.title: Bag had a hole
customer_reviews.text: One of the inner bags had a large hole in it, and the outer bag had a hole in it too. So when I pulled it out of the box, quite a bit of the product poured out before I knew what was happening. This stained the floor blue. I contacted Miracle-GRo and they could not help - saying this was an Amazon problem. This stuff really helps our flowers, but I am not happy with this purchase. A lot of the product was wasted when it spilled on the floor, and now I have a blue stained floor.
customer_reviews.author: G. R. Culbertson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for years, on potted plants and outdoors as well. I do not have a green thumb, but I think this plant food keeps me from killing all my flowers. I don't worry too much about measuring or timing, but it's never "burned" or caused any damage to my plants in spite of my careless applications. Plants look green and healthy when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: LizP

customer_reviews.title: Good plant food.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the product for a number of weeks. My house plants are mostly in old soil, ten plus years. Using the product my plants have perked up. The product comes in a plastic bag with a twist tie. The amount is measured with the supplied spoon. Easy enough but I suspect the twist tie will break, followed by the bag, before the product has been completely used.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Comstock sr.

customer_reviews.title: For the not green thumbs
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy trying to grow hot peppers. Try being the key word there. They need food to grow and this stuff is great. They love it!! The Habaneros told me so. The wife had some herbs and flowers which also enjoyed the plant food. I wouldn't argue with vegetation as it will take over the world soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Paratore Jr.

product_meta.title: Miracle-Gro Water Soluble All Purpose Plant Food, 3 Lb.
product_meta.description: Size:3 lb| Style:All Purpose| Pattern Name:BoosterMiracle-Gro Water Soluble All Purpose Plant Food instantly feeds vegetables, trees, shrubs, and houseplants to grow bigger and more beautiful than unfed plants. Simply feed them every 1-2 weeks. The formula is safe for all plants, and is guaranteed not to burn when used as directed. Get beautiful results with Miracle-Gro.
feature_bullets: Full of essential nutrients, it instantly feeds to grow bigger, more beautiful plants versus unfed plants
Use with the Miracle-Gro garden feeder or any watering can
For all flowers, vegetables, trees, shrubs and houseplants
Safe for all plants, guaranteed not to burn when used as directed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars17,166 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
